title: Solid vs Hematologic Cancer Gap Analysis
key_finding: Disease fragmentation explains the solid vs hematologic precision gap
explanation: Hematologic cancers (leukemia, lymphoma) have many specific subtypes with sparse GT coverage. Predictions hit low-GT diseases. Myeloma is an exception with concentrated coverage.

embedding_analysis.finding: Hematologic cancers cluster BETTER than solid tumors in embedding space
embedding_analysis.implication: Embedding quality is NOT the cause of precision gap

gt_density_analysis.implication: GT density is NOT the cause - hematologic actually has MORE per disease

actionable_implications: 1. Consider subtype-specific rules for hematologic cancers (like CML+imatinib rule in h201)
3. For leukemia: only trust predictions that match specific subtypes
4. Myeloma exceptions show concentrated coverage enables high precision
recommended_follow_up: h202: Subtype-Specific Leukemia Rules (AML, CML, ALL, CLL)
